title: Citi Dominican Republic Visits the MIR Foundation
summary: Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic - Citi Dominican Republic supports the MIR Foundation and low-income youth in La Romana. Maximo R. Vidal, Citi Country Officer for the Dominican Republic, along with other Citi executives, traveled to eastern Dominican Republic to gather with Citi Foundation-sponsored students, which will take part in the Professional Training School Program.
tag-1: Citi Dominican Republic Visits the MIR Foundation
tag-3: Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic – Citi Dominican Republic supports the MIR Foundation and low-income youth in La Romana. Maximo R. Vidal, Citi Country Officer for the Dominican Republic, along with other Citi executives, traveled to eastern Dominican Republic to gather with Citi Foundation-sponsored students, which will take part in the Professional Training School Program.
tag-4: "We are committed to the economic empowerment of the communities where we live and work, so we partnered with MIR to ease the inclusion of young Dominicans in the labor market, improving their employability and income expectations," said Vidal, reinforcing the vision of Citi.
tag-5: Operating since 1990, the MIR Foundation is a non-profit organization chaired by Lian Fanjul de Azqueta. It is dedicated to assisting children and their families overcome poverty by identifying and addressing their needs through collaborative and educational service programs.
tag-6: "The MIR Foundation has over 1,000 students, and our main purpose is the fostering of leaders that promote and continue our efforts. With Citi's support, 75 young people received training in hospitality and haute cuisine, and 50 of them now have permanent positions within Resorts of La Romana," stressed Lian Fanjul Azqueta, President of the MIR Foundation.
tag-7: "My wish is to be a good chef in the future, and after completing my studies at the MIR Foundation, I want to go onto college. I am grateful to Citi for having given me the opportunity to develop myself in the gastronomy sector," said Hamlet David Garcia, one of the students benefited by this program.
tag-8: The activity took place at the headquarters of the MIR Foundation, located in the North Buena Vista area, La Romana. Among the attendees were leading members of the Executive Committee, teachers and volunteers from the foundation. The students were grateful to the Citi Foundation and presented their future goals that apply the knowledge they will obtain thanks to Citi's support. This meeting reassures Citi's commitment to the community and the welfare of low-income people with a strong desire to excel.
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-11: Citi Foundation The Citi Foundation is committed to the economic empowerment and financial inclusion of individuals and families, particularly those in need, in the communities where we work so that they can improve their standard of living. Globally, the Citi Foundation targets its strategic giving to priority focus areas: Microfinance, Enterprise Development, Youth Education and Livelihoods, and Financial Capability and Asset Building. The Citi Foundation works with its partners in Microfinance and Enterprise Development to support environmental programs and innovations. Additional information can be found at www.citifoundation.com.
